DataElement.preferredName: B-Lymphocyte Recovery Occurrence Yes No Unk ND NA Previous Report Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not B-Cell recovery occurred or if it was previously reported.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Immunologically important lymphocyte that is not thymus-dependent, is either short-lived and naive or long-lived and of memory phenotype, and resembles the bursa-derived lymphocyte of birds in that it is responsible for the production of immunoglobulins._A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.

Concepts.definition: Immunologically important lymphocyte that is not thymus-dependent, is either short-lived and naive or long-lived and of memory phenotype, and resembles the bursa-derived lymphocyte of birds in that it is responsible for the production of immunoglobulins.
A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.
